title: It Ends with Us
review: A raw and emotional story tackling love, trauma, and resilience. Very impactful, especially for young adults.

title: It Starts with Us
review: A highly anticipated follow-up to It Ends with Us, this book shifts the focus to Atlas Corrigan and Lily Bloom, offering closure and healing after the events of the first book. It's a hopeful, emotional second-chance love story, balancing romance with themes of personal growth and recovery from past trauma. Fans loved finally seeing Lily get her happy ending!

title: Verity
review: Twisted, suspenseful, and totally unputdownable. Darker than Hoover’s usual style..

title: The Midnight Library
review: Explores regrets and second chances. Uplifting and thought-provoking with a hopeful message.

title: A Good Girl’s Guide to Murder
review: High schooler Pip investigates a closed murder case for her school project. Everyone believes Sal Singh killed Andie Bell, but Pip isn’t convinced. As she digs deeper, she uncovers dark secrets and puts herself in danger.

title: Reminders of Him
review: A mother fighting to reunite with her daughter. Heartbreaking but with a hopeful ending. Classic CoHo feels!

title: Twisted Love
review: Alex Volkov is ruthless and icy. Ava Chen is sunshine. It’s an opposites attract and forbidden romance with lots of angst and spice!

title: Twisted Games
review: Rhys Larsen is the ultimate protective alpha bodyguard. Bridget von Ascheberg is a princess. Major slow burn, forbidden, and super steamy! Fans LOVE Rhys!

title: Twisted Hate
review: Christian Harper is a morally grey billionaire who’s obsessed (in a good way!) with Stella Alonso. Protective, obsessive hero + slow burn fake dating. Fans say this is the darkest and steamiest of the four!

title: Twisted Lies
review: High schooler Pip investigates a closed murder case for her school project. Everyone believes Sal Singh killed Andie Bell, but Pip isn’t convinced. As she digs deeper, she uncovers dark secrets and puts herself in danger.

title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
review: The magical world opens up! Harry discovers he’s a wizard and enters Hogwarts. Light-hearted and whimsical, with themes of friendship and bravery.

title: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
review: A darker mystery unfolds at Hogwarts. Harry faces danger in the Chamber and uncovers secrets of the past.

title: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
review: Sirius Black escapes Azkaban. Harry learns about his parents' past and finds new family ties. Twists and emotional depth grow here.

title: Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire
review: The Triwizard Tournament tests Harry’s courage. Voldemort returns in a chilling climax. Stakes get higher!

title: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix
review: Dark times ahead. Harry builds Dumbledore’s Army and faces government corruption. A story of resistance and personal loss.

title: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
review: Dark secrets of Voldemort are revealed. Trust is tested, and a major betrayal changes everything. Heartbreaking and suspenseful.

title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows
review: The final battle. Harry, Ron, and Hermione go on a perilous quest. Themes of sacrifice, love, and courage lead to an epic conclusion.

title: La La Land
review: A modern musical about love, dreams, and sacrifice. Gorgeous cinematography and music.

title: A Quiet Place
review: A tense, emotional survival horror with minimal dialogue and maximum suspense.

title: Parasite
review: A gripping story that keeps you hooked till the end.

title: Barbie
review: A mind-bending thriller about dreams within dreams. Complex and visually stunning.

title: Inception
review: A gripping story that keeps you hooked till the end.

title: Twenty-Five Twenty-One
review: Nostalgic 90s vibe, first love, and dreams. Beautiful but bittersweet story—grab tissues!

title: Sweet Home
review: A dark, gripping survival thriller with monsters and psychological drama. Creepy but compelling!

title: Crash Landing on You
review: A South Korean heiress crash-lands in North Korea and meets an army officer. Iconic love story, lots of feels!

title: Vincenzo
review: A Mafia consigliere returns to Korea. Dark comedy with thrilling moments and a badass anti-hero.

title: All of Us are Dead
review: High school students trapped during a zombie outbreak. Intense, emotional, and full of survival drama!
